summary: This is a legal brief filed by Virginia Giuffre's attorneys in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to consolidate her civil appeal (regarding document unsealing) with her criminal appeal. The document argues consolidation would delay public access to judicial documents and serves Maxwell's interests in hindering the unsealing process rather than judicial efficiency.

persons.name: Virginia L Giuffre
persons.context: The plaintiff in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking to unseal documents. She is the party submitting this response opposing consolidation of appeals.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in both civil and criminal cases, seeking to consolidate her appeals. Described as attempting to delay the unsealing process through various tactics.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney representing Virginia Giuffre, listed as counsel on the legal filing.

persons.name: Sigrid S. McCawley
persons.context: Attorney representing Virginia Giuffre, listed as counsel and signatory on the legal filing.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: District Court judge overseeing the civil unsealing process, cited for denying Maxwell's motions and implementing the review protocol.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: District Court judge presiding over Maxwell's criminal case, cited for refusing to modify a protective order.

connections.description: Plaintiff and defendant in civil litigation regarding document unsealing, with Giuffre opposing Maxwell's procedural motions.
Boies serves as legal counsel representing Giuffre in her civil appeal against Maxwell.
McCawley serves as legal counsel representing Giuffre in her civil appeal against Maxwell.
Judge overseeing the civil unsealing process who has ruled against Maxwell's motions and described her tactics as delay attempts.
Judge presiding over Maxwell's criminal case who refused to modify a protective order related to evidence.

events.title: Court Order for Response
events.description: Second Circuit Court of Appeals ordered parties to respond to the Government's amicus letter brief regarding consolidation motion.

events.title: Government Amicus Brief Filing
events.description: U.S. Government filed amicus letter brief regarding Maxwell's motion to consolidate civil and criminal appeals.

events.title: Second Circuit Remand Order
events.description: Second Circuit ordered district court to conduct particularized review and unseal documents where public access presumption outweighs privacy interests.

locations: United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Virginia Giuffre opposes Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to consolidate her civil appeal (document unsealing) with her criminal appeal, arguing they involve completely separate legal issues.
The document alleges Maxwell has engaged in repeated delay tactics to hinder the document unsealing process ordered by the Second Circuit over 14 months earlier.
Giuffre's legal team argues consolidation would sacrifice justice by allowing Maxwell to 'hold hostage' the unsealing process by tying it to unrelated criminal proceedings.
The filing emphasizes the public's strong right of access to judicial documents and argues any delay from consolidation would violate this fundamental principle.
The civil appeal concerns whether Judge Preska abused her discretion in ordering documents unsealed, while the criminal appeal concerns evidence admissibility issues before Judge Nathan.
